summary.title: EdTrack Planning Model
summary.description: EdTrack is a web python application simulates a small educational system with features such as user registration, consent toggles, student records, and grade management.

threats.title: User Impersonation
threats.description: Threat actors impersonate legitimate users to gain unauthorized access
threats.mitigation:
Implement strong multi-factor authentication (MFA) mechanisms to verify user identities
Use CAPTCHA to prevent automated attacks
Regularly update authentication tokens

threats.title: HTTP Request Manipulation
threats.mitigation:
Implement input validation and output encoding
Use web application firewalls (WAFs)
Follow secure coding practices

threats.title: Grade Management Privilege
threats.description: Exploit missing role checks to submit arbitrary grades.

threats.title: Authentication Database
threats.description: Attackers modify or manipulate stored data
threats.mitigation:
Use encryption to protect data at rest
Employ integrity checks to detect tampering
Restrict access to authorized personnel only

threats.title: Consent Change Tampering
threats.description: Modify consent flag in transit to give false opt-in.

threats.title: Data Exposed
threats.description: Sensitive data is intercepted or exposed during transmission
threats.mitigation:
Use encryption for data in transit
Avoid sending sensitive data in URL parameters
Restrict access to authorized personnel only

threats.title: Consent Change Tampering
threats.description: Modify consent flag in transit to give false opt-in.

threats.title: Logging Repudiation
threats.description: If logs aren’t integrity-protected, an attacker could repudiate changes.

threats.title: Information Disclosure on Student Credentials
threats.description: Unencrypted at rest leads to unauthorized data leakage.

threats.title: Authentication Access
threats.description: Flood login endpoint to prevent legitimate access.

threats.title: HTTP Response Manipulation
threats.mitigation:
Implement input validation and output encoding
Use web application firewalls (WAFs)
Follow secure coding practices
